keyMoments.title: Hina's Debut at Tamarisk
keyMoments.description: Captain Hina of the Marines makes her first appearance, greeting Smoker and his unit at the port town of Tamarisk. She reveals her long-standing friendship with Smoker from their Marine Academy days.
keyMoments.significance: Introduction of a recurring Marine character who represents a different approach to justice and serves as a bridge between Smoker and the Marine establishment.

keyMoments.title: Hina Explains Government Cover-Up
keyMoments.description: Hina explains to Smoker that the World Government has decided to cover up the Straw Hats' involvement in defeating Crocodile to avoid the embarrassment of pirates succeeding where Marines failed.
keyMoments.significance: Shows Hina's pragmatic acceptance of government politics while still maintaining honesty with her friend Smoker.
keyMoments.quote: The World Government has decided to cover up the Straw Hats' involvement. They can't let it be known that pirates saved a kingdom when the Marines couldn't.

relationships.description: Hina and Smoker are old friends who joined the Marines at the same time and trained together at the Marine Academy. They address each other casually.

evolutionMoments.description: Hina greets Smoker at Tamarisk, revealing their long-standing friendship from their Marine Academy days.

reveals.information: Marine Captain with the epithet 'Black Cage Hina'
Old friend and classmate of Smoker from Marine Academy
User of the Ori Ori no Mi Devil Fruit (mentioned but not shown)

keyMoments.title: Offered False Promotion
keyMoments.description: Marine Headquarters contacts Smoker to credit him with Crocodile's defeat and offer him a promotion, despite knowing the Straw Hats actually defeated the Warlord.
keyMoments.significance: Sets up Smoker's moral choice between accepting false glory or standing by the truth.

keyMoments.title: Smoker Refuses Promotion and Denounces Cover-Up
keyMoments.description: Smoker angrily rejects the promotion, furiously telling Marine officials to 'go eat shit' and declaring that acknowledging the truth is 'real justice.' He refuses to take credit for the Straw Hats' actions.
keyMoments.significance: Defining character moment that establishes Smoker as a Marine who values truth and honor over rank and politics. Sets him apart as a maverick within the Marine organization.
keyMoments.quote: Tell those bastards at headquarters they can go eat shit! This is real justice!

keyMoments.title: Smoker Advises Tashigi to Become Stronger
keyMoments.description: Smoker counsels Tashigi to focus on becoming stronger rather than dwelling on the moral complexities of having aided pirates, encouraging her to use the experience as motivation.
keyMoments.significance: Shows Smoker's mentorship role and his philosophy that personal strength enables personal justice.
keyMoments.quote: Become stronger, Tashigi. That's the only way you'll be able to uphold your own justice.

relationships.description: Long-time friend and classmate from Marine Academy days. They address each other casually despite their ranks.

evolutionMoments.description: Reunites with Hina at Tamarisk, where their old friendship is revealed to the audience.

reveals.information: Smoker values truth and personal honor over rank, willing to defy Marine Headquarters to maintain his principles
Believes in 'real justice' based on truth rather than political expediency

keyMoments.title: Tashigi's Crisis of Justice
keyMoments.description: Tashigi struggles internally with having aided the Straw Hat Pirates, feeling it's a disgrace even though they were fighting for the right cause. Her sense of what constitutes 'justice' is deeply shaken.
keyMoments.significance: Key character development moment showing Tashigi's internal conflict and the moral complexity of the One Piece world.
keyMoments.quote: How can we call ourselves Marines when we had to rely on pirates to save a kingdom? What is true justice?

keyMoments.title: Tashigi Arrests Crocodile
keyMoments.description: Tashigi officially strips Crocodile of his Warlord of the Sea title and places him under arrest with evidence of confiscated Dance Powder ships.
keyMoments.significance: Tashigi's first major arrest of a Warlord-level criminal, though complicated by the knowledge that the Straw Hats actually defeated him.
keyMoments.quote: Crocodile, you are hereby stripped of your title as one of the Seven Warlords of the Sea and placed under arrest.

reveals.information: Deeply troubled by moral complexities and conflicts between institutional duty and personal ethics
Recognizes her own weakness and resolves to become stronger to uphold her sense of justice
